org.openhab.binding.velux.internal.config

Class VeluxThingConfiguration

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.smarthome.config.core.Configuration
      • org.openhab.binding.velux.internal.config.VeluxThingConfiguration

  • @NonNullByDefault
public class VeluxThingConfiguration
extends org.eclipse.smarthome.config.core.Configuration
    The VeluxThingConfiguration is a wrapper for configuration settings needed to access the Velux device.

    It contains the factory default values as well.

    There are three parts. Information for:

    • sceneName Name of a scene,
    • serial Unique identification of type actuator, rollershutter and window,
    • name Alternate Unique identification of type actuator, rollershutter and window,
    • inverted Value inversion for an actuator, rollershutter or window,
    • velocity Speed value for a scene,
    • sceneLevels Virtual shutter definition as a set of scenes imitating a shutter,
    • currentLevel Initial state of Virtual shutter definition.
    Author:
    Guenther Schreiner - Initial contribution., Andrew Fiddian-Green - adapted.

      currentLevel of type int, which represents the current shutter level.

      inverted of type Boolean, inverts each Channel value.
      (package private) java.lang.String name
      name of type String, identifying a io-homecontrol device by its registration name especially for somfy as they do not provide a valid serial number.
      (package private) java.lang.String sceneLevels
      sceneLevels of type String, identifying a number of Velux scenes which act together as a virtual shutter.
      (package private) java.lang.String sceneName
      sceneName of type String, identifying a Velux scene by human-readable name.
      (package private) java.lang.String serial
      serial of type String, identifying a io-homecontrol device by its serial number (i.e. 43:12:14:5A:12:1C:05:5F).
      (package private) java.lang.String velocity
      velocity of type String, describes the intended speed of action.

    • Field Detail

      • sceneName

        java.lang.String sceneName
        sceneName of type String, identifying a Velux scene by human-readable name.

        Configuration for the channel scene:

        • sceneName for identification of a set of settings, so called scene.

      • serial

        java.lang.String serial
        serial of type String, identifying a io-homecontrol device by its serial number (i.e. 43:12:14:5A:12:1C:05:5F).

        Configuration for the channels actuator, rollershutter and window:

        • serial for identification of a io-homecontrol device,
        • name for alternate identification of a io-homecontrol device,
        • inverted for modified value behavior.
        • velocity for modified action speed.

      • name

        java.lang.String name
        name of type String, identifying a io-homecontrol device by its registration name especially for somfy as they do not provide a valid serial number.

        Part of the Configuration for the channels actuator, rollershutter and window.

      • inverted

        java.lang.Boolean inverted
        inverted of type Boolean, inverts each Channel value. This means 0% will be handled as 100%, and vice versa, 100% will be handled as 0%.

        Part of the Configuration for the channels actuator, rollershutter and window.

      • velocity

        java.lang.String velocity
        velocity of type String, describes the intended speed of action. Possible values are defined within VeluxProductVelocity.

        Part of the Configuration for the channels actuator, rollershutter and window.

      • sceneLevels

        java.lang.String sceneLevels
        sceneLevels of type String, identifying a number of Velux scenes which act together as a virtual shutter. Each scene is defined to a corresponding shutter level.

        Configuration for the channel virtualshutter:

        • sceneLevels for identification of a set of settings, so called scene.

        Additionally it contains an internal variable for keeping the actual virtual shutter level.

        • currentLevel for identification of a set of settings, so called scene.

      • currentLevel

        int currentLevel
        currentLevel of type int, which represents the current shutter level.

        Private part of the Configuration for the channel virtualshutter.

        public VeluxThingConfiguration()
